intro: Crotalaria sylvicola, commonly known as the forest crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with stipules and produces yellow or orange flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are encased in a distinctive pod that splits open upon maturity to release the seeds. Crotalaria sylvicola is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
